--- title: "Field Experiments II" date: "March 15, 2023" format: html --- ## Overview This is the second week of field experiments. We discuss block randomization and pre-post designs as variants from the canonical design. The Diaz and Rossiter (2023) reading is a bit technical, focus on understanding what block randomization and pre-post designs are. I suggest paying attention to sections 1 through 3 and then skimming the rest. The lab focuses on the trade-offs of adopting these research design variants. ## Reading - [{{< fa book >}}]{style="color: #ac1455;"} [RD sections 20-22](https://book.declaredesign.org/research-design-lifecycle.html) - [{{< fa file-lines >}}]{style="color: #ac1455;"} Kalla, Joshua, Frances Rosenbluth, and Dawn Langan Teele. 2018. [“Are You My Mentor? A Field Experiment on Gender, Ethnicity, and Political Self-Starters.”](https://doi.org/10.1086/693984) *Journal of Politics* 80 (1): 337-341 - [{{< fa file-lines >}}]{style="color: #ac1455;"} Diaz, Gustavo, and Erin Rossiter. 2023. [“Balancing Precision and Retention in Experimental Design.”](https://gustavodiaz.org/files/research/precision_retention.pdf) *Working Paper* ## Slides ::: {.callout-tip} ## Navigation Click on the frame below and use the arrows to navigate. You can type ? (or shift + /) to see useful commands. :::
